channel.title: Website hosting
channel.description: Hi. I did not know where to publish this. I have a domain and i want to point it some where with cpanel. Must have atleast 5 mySQL databases, 10-15 emails over 1 FTP account and fantastico scripts? i dont know where to point my domain to. Please Post some decent websites i could use, thanks

item.title: Website hosting
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

kloplop321:

I wish my host could allow Ping, otherwise, I would show the thing I made… my computer is on 24/7 but the sad thing is, I go thru a router, that can’t port froward port 80, it really sucks.

You realise that you can run webservers on ports other than 80, right?

Read full topic

item.title: Website hosting
item.dc:creator: @kloplop321 kloplop321
item.description:
@kloplop321 wrote:

yes, and I talked with the company and they kept asking why I want to know how to change it and they kept changing the subject. Yes, and the Admin Center is on port 80, and it will go to it if I type my own IP or even 192.168.1.1 in the top. It really stinks, It causes anyone to connect to my computer to get a timed out error.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Cabby Cabby
item.description:
@Cabby wrote:

Well, Isn’t 80 the port on Internet?

I chose just to pay my self, I can go as low as $5 a month where I get my service, but that only has 1 MySQL database for it, you can hold more than 1 database’s information in 1 database, but with othernames, like how smf can have multiple forums on 1 database. But I pay $10 a month.
[/quote]

I only pay 10$ and I can have well Idk how many databases. But I have about 7 right now that are created. Two of which being used.[/quote]

i have a limit of 6 and I am using 5 right now, but I don’t think it matters if you just have all the tables with a different name

item.title: Website hosting
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

[quote=“Skating On Java, post:20, topic:73750”][quote author=Mopman link=topic=108297.msg1090387#msg1090387 date=1175704590]

IKick221. He hosts himself. Meaning hes got a computer thats really fast, on 24/7, That he hosts his website off.

You dont need it on 24/7, Taylor used to host me and he turned it of …

Haha… when you turn the server off, the site goes down. Otherwise, the hosting business would be incredibly easy.
[/quote]

A server, is the same as a computer, only with more space etc. And up usually 24/7…Sometimes dont have keyboards etc.[/quote]

Er, yes. That still dosen’t change the fact that when you turn it off, your website isn’t up.

Read full topic

item.title: Website hosting
item.dc:creator: @kloplop321 kloplop321
item.description:
@kloplop321 wrote:

Look, I figured this out A LONG time ago, If you want something good, someone, in the end has to pay for it. I chose just to pay my self, I can go as low as $5 a month where I get my service, but that only has 1 MySQL database for it, you can hold more than 1 database’s information in 1 database, but with othernames, like how smf can have multiple forums on 1 database. But I pay $10 a month. I use Hostek, they have the best quality customer service that will get back to you in less than one day (on a busy day). I was tired of having adds on my website, I was tired of having so many sub domains just to get something done, and the links were always so long. In the end, just a little money a month can get you so much if you weren’t such a cheap person.

[center]http://hostek.com/web-hosting-plans.asp[/center]

Read full topic
